question: Who is the recipient of the 2019 Abel Prize for mathematics?
explanation: Prof. Karen Uhlenbeck of the University of Texas at Austin has become first woman to win the Abel Prize, one of the worldâ€™s most prestigious international mathematics awards. The award is sometimes called the Nobel Prize of mathematics. She has been awarded the 6 million Norwegian kroner ($700,000) prize for her work in the fields of geometric partial differential equations, gauge theory and integrable systems and for the fundamental impact of her work on analysis, geometry and mathematical physics. The prize was first awarded in 2003 to honor the 19th-century Norwegian mathematician Niels Henrik Abel.
